file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-22-06-04 - RUDDER HYDRAULIC RESTRICTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL RUDDER HYDRAULIC RESTRICTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: JAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT (POST-MOD SB 145-27-0015 OR FACTORY- MODIFIED) 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the hydraulic restrictor of the rudder control system. B. The hydraulic restrictor is installed in the compartment behind the rear pressure bulkhead. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY JAA-CERTIFIED AIR- CRAFT (POST-MOD SB 27-22-06-000-801-A HYDRAULIC RESTRICTOR - REMOVAL 145-27-0015 OR FAC- TORY-MODIFIED) JAA-CERTIFIED AIR- CRAFT (POST-MOD SB HYDRAULIC RESTRICTOR - INSTALLA- 27-22-06-400-801-A 145-27-0015 OR FAC- TION TORY-MODIFIED) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-22-06 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-22-06-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: JAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT (POST-MOD SB 145-27-0015 OR FACTORY- MODIFIED) 2. HYDRAULIC RESTRICTOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the hydraulic restrictor of the rudder control system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-42-00/100 - HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - PRESSURIZATION WITH AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200 HTS C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Compartment behind the rear pressure 311 312AR bulkhead D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 pair available Fluid Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 pair available Base, Fluid Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Compartment behind the rear pressure 1 Does the task bulkhead I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Release the pressure of the hydraulic system ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-22-06 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 and ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them. (3) Open access door 312AR (AMM MPP 06-42-00/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Disconnect the hydraulic tube (1) from the hydraulic restrictor (2). (2) Disconnect the hydraulic restrictor (2) from the tee at the hydraulic tube assembly (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-22-06 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

HYDRAULIC RESTRICTOR 3. HYDRAULIC TUBE ASSEMBLY TEE ( REF. ) DET. B 145AMM270351.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-22-06 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-22-06-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: JAA-CERTIFIED AIRCRAFT (POST-MOD SB 145-27-0015 OR FACTORY- MODIFIED) 3. HYDRAULIC RESTRICTOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the hydraulic restrictor of the rudder control system. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-42-00/100 - RUDDER MOVABLE PRIMARY STOP MECHANISM - AMM TASK 27-21-00-700-801-A/500 OPERATIONAL CHECK AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/200 HYDRAULIC SYSTEM - BLEED OF AIR C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION Compartment behind the rear pressure 311 312AR bulkhead D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber Gloves, Phosphate Ester-Base, Protection for the hands 1 pair available Fluid Resistant Commercially Rubber Goggles, Phosphate Ester- Protection for the eyes 1 pair available Base, Fluid Resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Compartment behind the rear pressure 1 Does the task bulkhead EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-22-06 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING:THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE RUBBER GOGGLES AND GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (1) Connect the hydraulic restrictor (2) to the tee at the hydraulic tube assembly (3). (2) Connect the hydraulic tube (1) to the hydraulic restrictor (2). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 and ELEC PUMP 2 circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from them. (2) Bleed the air from the hydraulic system lines ( AMM TASK 29-10-00-860-803-A/200). (3) Make sure that there are no leaks in the hydraulic restrictor. (4) Do an operational check of the Movable Stop Mechanism System ( AMM TASK 27-21-00-700-801-A/500). (5) Close access door 312AR (AMM MPP 06-42-00/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-22-06 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
